translated: Inscription on Faith Mind
The ultimate Way is not difficult, just avoid picking and choosing, only do not love and hate,
Then it is clear and bright, a hair's breadth of difference, and heaven and earth are set apart.
If you want to manifest it, do not dwell on conformity or opposition, the conflict between conformity and opposition,
Is a disease of the mind, not understanding the profound meaning, in vain you contemplate stillness.
It is the same as the great void, without lack and without excess, precisely because of grasping and rejecting,
Therefore it is not so, do not pursue conditioned arising, do not dwell in emptiness, endure,
With a single, level mind, it naturally disappears by itself, stop movement and return to stillness,
Stopping only increases movement, if you are stuck between the two, how can you know the one kind?
If the one kind is not understood, both places lose their effectiveness, eliminate existence and nonexistence,
Follow emptiness and turn away from emptiness, much speech and much thought, only become more out of accord.
Cut off speech and thought, there is no place that is not penetrated, return to the source and attain the purport,
Following illumination, the principle is lost. In an instant, reverse illumination. The victory surpasses the previous emptiness.
The previous emptiness transforms, all due to false views. Do not seek truth.
Only need to cease views. The two views do not abide. Be careful not to pursue.
As soon as there is right and wrong, one loses one's mind in confusion. The second arises from the first.
The one should also not be guarded. When the one mind does not arise, the myriad dharmas are faultless.
Without fault, there are no dharmas. Non-arising, non-mind. Able to follow the extinction of objects.
The object follows the ability to sink. The object is due to the object's ability. The ability is due to the object's ability.
If you want to know the two sections, they are originally one emptiness. One emptiness is the same as two.
Equally containing myriad images, not seeing coarse or fine. How can there be partiality?
The essence of the great way is vast. Without difficulty, without hardship. Small views are suspicious.
Turning faster, turning slower. Grasping it beyond measure, the mind enters the wrong path.
Let it be natural, its essence has no coming or going, follow its nature and accord with the Way
Tranquil and carefree, free from vexations, fixated thoughts deviate from the truth, sinking and dullness are not good
Not good at exhausting the spirit, what is the use of being distant or close? If you want to enter the One Vehicle
Do not dislike the six sense objects, the six sense objects are not bad, they are the same as right enlightenment
The wise are unconditioned, the foolish bind themselves, the Dharma has no different Dharma
Deludedly self-attached, using the mind to guard the mind, isn't this a great mistake?
Deluded birth is tranquil and chaotic, enlightenment has no likes or dislikes, all dualistic extremes
Deludedly self-measured, a dream, an illusion, a flower in the sky, what is the use of grasping?
Gain and loss, right and wrong, let go all at once, if the eyes do not sleepğŸ”½All dreams will naturally disappear, if the mind is not different, the myriad dharmas are one suchness
The essence of one suchness is mysterious, forgetting conditions as it is, the myriad dharmas are equally observed
Returning to the natural, erasing its basis, incomparable
Stopping movement, no movement; moving, no stopping; both not established
How can there be one? Ultimately reaching the end, not abiding in rules
Opening the mind to equality, all actions cease; doubts completely purified
Correct faith is straight, nothing left; nothing to remember
Empty and bright by nature, not exhausting mental power; not a place of thought and deliberation
Difficult to fathom with conceptual cognition; the true suchness of the dharma realm, no other, no self
If urgent, only the word non-dual is appropriate; non-dual is all the same
Nothing is not included; the wise of the ten directions all enter this principle
The principle is neither short nor long; one thought is myriad years, myriad years is one thought; no presence, no absence
The ten directions are right before one's eyes; the extremely small is the same as the large; delusion ends in the realm of objects
The extremely great is the same as the small, its boundaries are not seen, existence is precisely non-existence,
non-existence is precisely existence, if it is not like this, it must not be guarded,
one is precisely all, all is precisely one, just able to be like this,
what worries are not completed? Faithful mind is not two, faithful mind is not two,
the path of speech is cut off, not past, present, or future.
The end of the Inscription on Faith in Mind.
